tweets.text: My proxy fights at McDonald's & Kroger differed from most companies I target as an activist b/c both are performing well, financially. The issue of a lack of accountability remains the same however (in this case, treatment of workers & animals). Read more: https://t.co/lZLDdR4udI

On #EarthDay, @McDonaldsCorp and @Kroger may tout their focus on #ESG initiatives, but scientists agree that industrialized agriculture (including #CAFOs within these companies’ supply chains) is contributing to major  #sustainability violations, #pollution and #AnimalCruelty https://t.co/1KHwrDoxMu
You can also view the letter at https://t.co/5SJzAwGd9H https://t.co/PyUmcpXjkr
RT @WSJ: Carl Icahn is urging BlackRock and other big index-fund managers focused on socially conscious investing to support his proxy figh…

3/3 Even though we have great corporations, the boards of these companies don't hold their CEOs accountable, and we are therefore not nearly as productive as we should be, which is a major reason for inflation and the wealth gap.

Just released our 20-slide ISS presentation in opposition to Dell's offer for $DVMT. Meeting w ISS today. Slide 4 is an excellent summary of our opposition. See full presentation, which includes other important information, here: https://t.co/16Ak7V5h1j https://t.co/BdiCxD0ccT
